intro: Rhexia scabriuscula, commonly known as roughleaf bluets, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has rough, hairy stems and leaves. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a distinctive rough texture. Rhexia scabriuscula is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in acidic soils and is often found in forest understories.
